intro: Spergularia microsperma subsp. microsperma, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a small annual herb with slender, erect stems and hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas or disturbed habitats. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, allowing it to colonize new areas efficiently.
